titles.title: Natural Born Citizen Act
A bill to define the term "natural born Citizen" as used in the Constitution of the United States to establish eligibility for the Office of President.
Natural Born Citizen Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Committee on the Judiciary. Hearings held.

bill.summary: Natural Born Citizen Act - Defines the constitutional term "natural born citizen," to establish eligibility for the Office of President, as: (1) any person born in, and subject to the jurisdiction of, the United States; and (2) any person born outside the United States who derives citizenship at birth from U.S. citizen parents, or who is adopted by the age of 18 by U.S. citizen parents who are otherwise eligible to transmit citizenship.
